main event: A radar station at the Gimili RCAF base in Canada detected two fast-moving, circular objects on November 7, 1957.
interesting points: The objects were detected on radar, moving rapidly to the southeast and south, disappearing after 3-4 minutes.
The radar operator described the targets as very strong, fast-moving, and of circular shape, giving the impression of being intelligently controlled.
No aircraft were known to be in the area at the time of the sightings.
The weather conditions were reported as wind from 220 degrees at 30 knots, visibility 15 miles, and a ceiling of 2000 feet with no precipitation.
A rough sketch or drawing was included in the report, showing a curved shape labeled
sighted object: two fast-moving, circular objects detected on radar
photographs: no, the report includes a sketch or drawing rather than photographs
